Netherlands 158 for 4 (Ackermann 41*, Myburgh 37, Cooper 35, Maharaj 2-27) beat South Africa 145 for 8 (Rossouw 25, Glover 3-9, Klaassen 2-20, de Leede 2-25) by 13 runs
South Africa tumbled out of the T20 World Cup after a shock 13-run defeat to the Netherlands.
South Africa's NRR falls below Pakistan's, which means they are officially knocked out.
The Netherlands amassed 158 for four after being asked to bat first, with Tom Cooper’s quickfire 35 off 19 balls followed by Colin Ackermann’s unbeaten 41 off 26 deliveries.
Roelof van der Merwe's incredible catch to dismiss David Miller
Netherlands' catching proved crucial in the end: Markram was nabbed sharply at short cover to break a stable stand, and Miller was caught by van der Merwe.
While all of South Africa’s top-six reached double figures, Rilee Rossouw top-scored with just 25 off 19 balls and they reached 145 for eight to bring their campaign to an abrupt halt.
Brandon Glover took 3 wickets for 9 runs.
Fred Klaassen took 2 wickets for 20 runs.
Colin Ackermann's finishing with 41 not out off 26
Stephan Myburgh's aggressive batting at the start
South Africa's entire top six threw away starts.
Keshav Maharaj was caught by O'Dowd off de Leede for 13 runs.
Heinrich Klaasen was caught by van Beek off de Leede for 21 runs.
